/ BACK OF THE OVENS / MEDICAL STORAGE ROOM
UNDERGROUND STORAGE AREA / TUNNEL / LIFT / OVENS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gas chamber with plaster walls. Artificial light comes from a low ceiling. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A low, long noise of a_hea industrial fan, before stoppi with reverberation. Saul is hosing the ground mechanically, slowly, directing hose here and there, his face focused. In the BACKGROUND, human FIGURES come and go rapidly. Som draw nearer Saul, and start pulling backward, and then OF SCREEN, heavy loads. TWO MEN around Saul seem to struggle with something below Saul turns off the hose and leans toward the ground. He h the men. The men carry away their load. The figures around Saul move increasingly fast, quietly, if commanded by invisible fear and discipline. A low whimper can be heard from underneath. Saul tries to look for the source of the whimper. He freezes. A light-haired man comes near him. He is 30 but looks 50, name is HIRSCH. He wears the same clothes as Saul. His de set eyes look down with worry at the source of the whimpe Hirsch waves at someone OFF SCREEN. Another prisoner, who seems to have more authority, draws closer. He is a short but strong young man in his late twenties, and a foreman in the Kommando. He is called FEIGENBAUM. He looks towards the source of the whimper an hurries away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul watches as Hirsch lifts up the bruised corpse of an ADOLESCENT BOY with dark-brown hair. Hirsch carries it to corner of the tunnel and puts it onto a bench that anothe MAN has grabbed from the undressing room. Saul follows Hirsch with his eyes. Behind the scene, dozens of PRISONERS rapidly carry out t routine, regardless of the agonising boy. Some are pourin water. Some others take heavy loads to a freight-elevator WELL DRESSED MAN walks around, stops now and then, writin down information, assisted by a prisoner. A few SS GUARDS dressed in green and gray, armed, watch over the scene. Behind them, Feigenbaum comes back with a short man in a white gown, a Jewish doctor called MIKLOS. From closer, h gown looks less maculate: it is full of stains and dirt._ Shooting Draft April 25, 2014

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks towards the bench, Saul walks closer to them. O bench lays a boy, around twelve years old. Miklés looks a the boy with weary eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hardly has the time to put a hand on the boy’s body th from behind, a tall SS DOCTOR arrives, a white medical go over his SS uniform. Miklos steps aside. He talks quietly German with a Hungarian accent. +

dialogues.speaker: MIKLOS
dialogues.text: (in German) Still breathes. The SS Doctor takes a stethoscope out of his pocket and coldly examines the boy. He invites the Jewish doctor to touch the boy’s throat. + The members of the Sonderkommando working behind have somewhat slowed down their pace, some seem to glance furtively at the scene. The SS doctor puts his gloved hand on the boy’s mouth. Mi looks up at the SS doctor. The hand moves to recover the as well. The whimper stops. The SS doctor whispers in Miklos’s ear. Orders are shouted behind to accelerate the processes. An SS GUARD is drawn to the little group. +

dialogues.speaker: SS GUARD I
dialogues.text: (in German, to Hirsch) Back to work, fast! He lifts up his stick, but Hirsch already hurries back to gas chamber. The guard then turns to Saul, who gets back work. The SS doctor takes off his glove and puts it into his pocket. He looks around, vaguely observing the members of Sonderkommando who accelerate their work. Lost in his thoughts, as if he had already forgotten the incident, he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: goes away. + Saul looks back at the scene, and draws towards the bench His eyes are focused on the body. + Miklos steps back. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in German) I only saw this once before, that girl some time ago. He looks at Feigenbaum. Feigenbaum stays quiet, waiting f orders. Behind, Saul is already very close.

dialogues.speaker: MIKLOS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in German_to Feigenbaum) He ordered an autopsy. Bring it to the room, will you? Miklos leaves. Feigenbaum sighs and approaches the bench. Saul stands up front of him and tries to utter words in Yiddish.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in broken Yiddish) I‘l1l do it. Saul turns his back on Feigenbaum and seizes the body. Feigenbaum stands before him - he looks at Saul.

dialogues.speaker: FEIGENBAUM
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) What’s it to you? Saul doesn’t answer and goes into the corridor with the b in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Saul carries the body as if it was still alive, the boy’s face toward his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul enters the autopsy room of the Krematorium carrying lifeless body and stops. The autopsy room is a room with a tiny window on the side a door half open on another room, where FIGURES seem to b moving at times. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014 In the middle of the room stands Miklos, the Jewish doct On a stained stone operating table, he examines the insid of a corpse laid out. An ASSISTANT, prisoner of the Sonderkommando stands next to him, taking notes and assis him. Barely glancing up at Saul, Miklos signals to Saul a benc the side of the room. Beside the bench, all sorts of medi instruments can be seen. Saul seems to stiffen upon seeing these instruments.

dialogues.speaker: MIKLOS
dialogues.text: (in German) Just put it there. Saul does not move.

dialogues.speaker: MIKLOS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in German) Just put it there. Now. Saul looks at the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, hesitating) Doctor... if you will... Miklos looks at Saul.

dialogues.speaker: MIKLOS
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) You're Hungarian? I didn’t know. He keeps dissecting. The assistant comes to Saul and takes the body from him, and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: brings the body to a bench. Saul follows the body to the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The assistant keeps looking at Saul, then returns to the table.

dialogues.speaker: MIKLOS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) Where are you from?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) From Ungvar. A beat. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  SAUL (CONT’D) (in Hungarian, low) Doctor, please don’t cut this boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miklos looks up, puts down the dissecting tool. +

dialogues.speaker: MIKLOS
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, low, ironic) What else could I do?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, low) Keep it as it is, at least for a few hours. Miklos looks at him suspiciously. And at the boy. He come next to the bench.

dialogues.speaker: MIKLOS
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) No. Saul stands still, looking at Miklés. +

dialogues.speaker: MIKLOS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, low) He one of yours? Saul hesitates. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: MIKLOS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, low) Even then. You don’t need it. He pauses and looks behind him at the figures in the othe room.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, low) But you people do.

dialogues.speaker: MIKLOS
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, low) I'm a prisoner like you. Miklés_ looks at Saul. Saul looks back in an inexpressive but does not look away. Miklés bends forward and looks at body. +

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting Draft April 25, 2014

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, low) I'll give you five minutes alone at dinner time. But in the end, it will burn with the rest. Saul nods again, but does_not move_away from the bench. H examines the boy’s face. Miklos_throws a sheet onto the body. Saul covers the body with it.

dialogues.speaker: MIKLOS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Auslander. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Saul. The doctor barely pays attention to him. Saul finally lea the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul comes back to the tunnel. The members of the Sonderkommando are still busy, under t supervision of Feigenbaum. Two GUARDS are standing on the side, talking. Feigenbaum looks up at Saul.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: in broken Yiddish) + Where... from? +

dialogues.speaker: FEIGENBAUM
dialogues.text: in Yiddish) + What? +

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: in broken Yiddish) + Last... transport? Hungary? +

dialogues.speaker: FEIGENBAUM
dialogues.text: in Yiddish) + Back to work! + Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  10. Saul _ goes toward the doorway leading to the gas chamber Inside, Hirsch and another PRISONER of the Sonderkommando

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cleaning the floor. Saul kneels down and scrubs the floor.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: in broken Yiddish) Hungarians?

dialogues.speaker: HIRSCH
dialogues.text: in Yiddish) Who?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: in broken Yiddish) This transport?

dialogues.speaker: HIRSCH
dialogues.text: in Yiddish) No. Maybe. The prisoner next to them intervenes.

dialogues.speaker: PRISONER I
dialogues.text: in Yiddish, low) Some other camp. Feigenbaum loses his patience, he takes a few steps towar Saul, makes a threating move with his arm. The momentum of the move suddenly stops and Feigenbaum st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul looks up and sees a serious face with commanding eye This is ABRAHAM WARSZAWSKI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feigenbaum turns away. Abraham comes to Saul and kneels down. He scrubs and look

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul.

dialogues.text: Saul and Abraham stand in front of the lift as it comes d empty. They start piling bodies in it. They glance at each other In the background men of the Sonderkommando close the doo the tunnel that leads to the undressing romm and the gas chamber.

dialogues.text: A tall and robust man, around 30 years old, the Jewish Oberkapo named ELIEZER BIEDERMAN comes down from the stai next to the lift to inspect the ongoing operations. He ke on tapping a decorated tin box with a rolled cigarette. H wears an armband adorned with a blue star of David, on wh the letters of the word OBERKAPO have been sewn in black. He nods at Abraham,_and goes toward the closed door where other Sonderkommando PRISONERS are waiting. Abraham follo Biederman. Saul follows him._Abraham looks at Saul, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, whispers) I’1l help you. Abraham reaches Biederman before the door. They start whispering. On the other side of the door, hundreds of footsteps can be heard. All the men wait at the door, sta down. A_guard opens the door. Abraham goes to the doorway. Saul follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, whispers) Forget the food. The shiny only.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: With lowered head, Saul and Abraham enter the undressing room. Biederman stops in the doorway and talks to the GUA Some men are already busy taking the clothes from the rac They throw everything to the centre of the hall. Other prisoners sort out the personal objects found in th pile of small-size bundles stacked up on the floor. Some of them are putting the food they find in their pock Saul and Abraham take some clothes, inspect them then thr them onto the floor. Saul leaves Abraham and goes in a corner, where documents laid out on the floor. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kneels down. On the floor, papers, pictures and identi papers are gathered. Pretending to sort those out, Saul l through the pictures. In the background a MAN of the Sonderkommando gets hit on head. Saul quickly thumbs through all kinds of portraits, famil pictures. YANKL, a 19-year-old prisoner, dressed in a dark overcoat stops by him. Yankl takes the pile away from Saul_and_goes out of the r through the door ajar, to the exit area where a stove sta Saul gazes at Yankl, approaching a dark silhouette lit by fire of a stove. This is FRANKEL, throwing the papers int the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul stares at Frankel, motionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KAPO, with a black armband with the word KAPO sewn in w letters, comes to_Saul. Saul takes a new pile of documents, stands up, and leaves undressing room_to the exit area.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE EXIT AREA
dialogues.text: The exit area is full of bundles of clothes. Prisoners ca the bundles outside. He crosses Yankl’s path as Yankl is going back to the undressing room._Yankl_ stops him

dialogues.speaker: YANKL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) Give me this. Yankl takes the pile from Saul. Saul does not stop, and continues his way toward Frankel. Yankl follows him.

dialogues.speaker: YANKL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) See my pants? Under his coat, a red pair of WWI cavalry trousers can be seen.

dialogues.speaker: YANKL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) They’re older than me! ooting Draft April 25, 2014 tee tt  13. He laughs, showing Saul his pants.

dialogues.speaker: YANKL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) Four months I’ve been here, you listen to me! Saul doesn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: YANKL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) Forever here, you and I, as if family. (changes tone) Go clean yourself, you stink. Saul goes to Frankel near the stove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his early forties, Frankel holds a metal stick. He pic the papers on fire. Photos, diplomas, ID papers disappear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the flames. He murmurs something continuously. Yankl follows Saul.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKEL
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish, to Yankl, in a gentle voice) Calm down. Cries of agony can be heard from the chamber. Yankl_ stops talking and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in broken Yiddish) Rabbi. Someone. I want... bury. Frankel stops, looks at him_intensely.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKEL
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) Bury? Just say the prayer.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in broken Yiddish, whispering) I have the body. Help me. Abraham arrives in the exit area, discreetly looking into bundles in the heap of clothes piling up next to the exit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLISH KAPO walks toward the stove. He wears a black armband with the inscription KAPO sewed in white on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ting Draft April 25, 2014  14.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKEL
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) Get rid of it. Do you know the prayer? Saul shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) I'll say it. What’s his name? Saul keeps silent.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) There’s nothing more to do.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in broken Yiddish, angry) It’s not enough. The Polish kapo spots Abraham.

dialogues.speaker: POLISH KAPO
dialogues.text: (in German) What are you doing in my Kommando? Saul looks at the scene. The Polish kapo turns to Saul. POLISH KAPO (CONT’D) (in German, to Saul) And you?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in German) A work... SS GUARD II. (in German) A work? Don’t you speak German, swine? He looks at Saul, menacing. A beat. Saul glances at Frankel. Biederman comes to them.

dialogues.speaker: BIEDERMAN
dialogues.text: (in German) What? Shooting Draft April 25, 2014

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in German) They don’t belong here. Biederman pulls away the Kapo, towards the exit.

dialogues.speaker: BIEDERMAN
dialogues.text: (in German) I sent them here to help.

dialogues.speaker: POLISH KAPO
dialogues.text: (in German) I don’t need them. This is my Kommando.

dialogues.speaker: BIEDERMAN
dialogues.text: (in German) I am the Oberkapo.

dialogues.speaker: POLISH KAPO
dialogues.text: (in Polish) You’re a Jewish rat. 15. Biederman hits the Polish kapo in the face. The Polish ka falls on his back. Biederman turns away and walks toward the door, followed Saul and Abraham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three men cross the tunnel. Biederman looks tense. Abraham looks at Biederman, worried.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: in Yiddish) He can feel it’s coming for us.

dialogues.speaker: BIEDERMAN
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) It was nothing. They go to a corner next to the lift. As other men come some racks where gas masks are hanging, they proceed to darker corner. Abraham discreetly hands a few pieces of golden objects Biederman. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014 near a to  BIEDERMAN (CONT’D) (in Yiddish) Not much. And him? Abraham looks at Saul.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, to Abraham) I have nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biederman looks at Abraham and leaves. + Feigenbaum appears behind them, wiping the sweat off his face.

dialogues.speaker: FEIGENBAUM
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) Got me some paper?

dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) No.

dialogues.speaker: FEIGENBAUM
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish, slightly disappointed) Come on then. Biederman nods. Saul and Abraham follow Feigenbaum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul is at the door of the gas chamber. He’s waiting amon other prisoners. Muted cries of agony can still be heard. The members of t Sonderkommando_look exhausted and they sweat. A man is bu cleaning his hands of dirt and oil, but to no avail. One man is talking to himself in a very low voice, as if praying. + After a while, Saul draws closer to Abraham.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, low) I need your help. Abraham does not answer. The cries and shouts behind the door decrease. Saul stops lowers his head. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  17. SAUL (CONT’D) (in Hungarian, low) I_need another rabbi. Abraham looks at him in a strange way.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) You? A rabbi? Saul does not answer. Saul sits down onto the ground, speechless. ABRAHAM (CONT ’D in Hungarian, low) The one at the stove, he’s not good? The noise of the ventilation goes on.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, low) A rabbi won’t save you from fear. Saul looks at Abraham. Behind Abraham's harsh look, Saul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: some kind of sympathy. Abraham is already looking at _an SS OFFICER who walks ou the penumbra, all the way to the glass on the heavy door looks through it for long seconds.

dialogues.speaker: SS OFFICER
dialogues.text: in German Business is finished. Abraham grabs Saul’s hand and pulls him up. In the background the guards are opening the door. Around them, members of the kommando are gathering, encouraged b the kapos. Some men in gas masks pull out the first bodies and drag into the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, low) You heard of the “Apikoyres”? Saul shakes his head. Hirsch starts paying attention to their conversation. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, low) Mietek?

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, low) That Polish worm.

dialogues.speaker: SS GUARD 2
dialogues.text: (in German, shouts) Fast! + Saul pulls out a body and drags it to the lift. As he com back Abraham and Hirsch are with him.

dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) I don’t know. Hirsch intervenes.

dialogues.text: (in Yiddish, low, with + gestures) + I know him. He has two scars on each side of the face. +

dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, low) He has a scar on both cheeks?

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, low) That’s what he says. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  19. Saul and Abraham pulls out two other bodies. Same route.

dialogues.text: (in German) Move! Move the pieces! Saul tries to wipe off the blood. He grabs a new load and carries it with someone else to the lift. Instead of going back to the chamber, Saul catches up wit Abraham and Biederman as they head toward the narrow corr toward the exit area.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish, low) There's a woman in Kanada. She has the package for us. Can you send someone for it?

dialogues.speaker: BIEDERMAN
dialogues.text: in Yiddish) In two days. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014

dialogues.text: in Yiddish, low) We don’t have days. They already started making a list of us. Biederman looks at Abraham, in a harsh way.

dialogues.speaker: BIEDERMAN
dialogues.text: in Yiddish) Who told you that?

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: in Yiddish) My guy. At the office. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: BIEDERMAN
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish, low) First let’s take those pictures. Abraham stiffens.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish, low) What pictures, Eli? We have no time for this. It’s our turn. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: BIEDERMAN
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish, low) You think you can blow up this whole thing?

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish, low) Your pictures won’t bring an_army here to free us. A pause.

dialogues.speaker: BIEDERMAN

dialogues.text: (in broken Yiddish, low) I'll do it.

dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, low, surprised) Do what? ooting Draft April 25, 2014 t+ tt

dialogues.speaker: SAUL

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, low) You don’t even know.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: in Hungarian, low) I_have to get outside.

dialogues.text: (in Yiddish, low, to Saul) You speak Yiddish? Abraham looks at Saul.

dialogues.text: Saul follows Biederman out in the courtyard into the blin sun. The air is filled with sounds, noises, as if we were in a busy industrial zone.

dialogues.text: in German, to the guards) He’s with me. Biederman waves at a young man in striped trousers, who hurries to them carrying a wooden case. His name is KATZ. Followed by one GUARD, the three men cross the courtyard. In the grove nearby, a new group of civilians is waiting go under the ground. They stop in front of the gates, where two GUARDS are standing. BIEDERMAN_(CONT’D (in German, to the guards) They're with me. The three men follow the fence. Smoke rises above the fie

dialogues.text: As they go outthe gates, they follow the wooden fence of Krematorium to another wing of the building, ending with door.

dialogues.text: They enter the door. They are in a dark narrow corridor. Saul looks out through the doorway to the grove near the field in front of them. A heavy, white-gray smoke rises in the air from the groun the field. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014

dialogues.text: (in Yiddish, to Saul) If a kapo shows up. Saul puts the bracelet in his shoe.

Getting closer to the door, Saul watches the scene, it se more and more obvious these men are burning corpses in a An SS officer wearing dirty clothes runs up and down. A 20 year old fair-haired Polish Oberkapo, MIETEK, a stic his hand, comes toward them. He wears a black triangle on jacket. BIEDERMAN (CONT’D) (in Yiddish) Wait here. Biederman goes out of the building and toward Mietek. The men seemingly do not appreciate each other, the situation tense.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in broken Yiddish, to Katz) Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: KATZ
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) Shut up. In the distance, a sweating SS GUARD roams the scene. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  24.

dialogues.text: your writings KZ. Feigenbaum stays still. Saul goes behind the curtain. IN SAUL’S CORNER + Saul enters new sections until he reaches a corner with a camp and pieces of cloth. Saul lays the body of the boy on a bed-camp. Some light c in from the common area through the canvas and low-toned conversations can be heard. Saul sits down on the ground. Suddenly, Abraham appears behind the curtain.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, low) Saul! Saul jumps up and exits the corner through the curtain.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) We're getting more weapons tonight. We should be ready by the morning.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) The morning? Abraham looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) It’s my plan.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) I have to find a rabbi. Abraham stops. +

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: in Hungarian) + I'll get you a rabbi after. + Saul does not seem to believe him. +

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  25 26 45.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) I’1l_ need you Saul.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) You didn’t even care much before.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, smiling) I still don’t. Saul looks up at Abraham, tired.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) Have to eat. Saul goes toward the common table.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: INT. KREMATORIUM - PRISONERS’ HALL UNDER THE ROOF - NIGHT Saul eats at the table. The men around him either do not pay attention or look at him, speechless. Saul looks on, tired. Abraham stands by his side. Men are talking next to them in Yiddish. + The rumble increases around them, so that the conversatio becomes less and less audible.

dialogues.speaker: HIRSCH
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish, in awe) + Not just her body. The way she looked at me. +

dialogues.speaker: HIRSCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) ... I had to talk to her. She was breathtaking.

dialogues.speaker: YANKL
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish, cynical) So she saw it coming!_Tell me!! + Hirsch sits down. + Saul rubs his temple. He stops eating. + Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  46.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) I wish I understood nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) You used to talk about women all the time!

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) I don’t remember. Abraham looks up, and sees Biederman coming in, tapping a cigarette on his tin box. He is followed by a tall and strongly built man with a harsh look. He is a Russian prisoner in his forties, his name is VASSILI. They talk t Katz. The three men stop in front of Saul. Biederman gives the cigarette to Vassili, who lights it as he studies Saul.

dialogues.speaker: VASSILI
dialogues.text: (in Russian, to Saul) Are you good with weapons? Saul looks at him, worried. Abraham intervenes.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Russian, to Vassili) No. Vassili keeps on staring at Saul.

dialogues.speaker: VASSILI
dialogues.text: (in Russian, to Saul) I’ll teach you.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish, angry, to Biederman ) He’s no fighter!

dialogues.speaker: BIEDERMAN
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish, to Abraham) He saved the day. No need to be his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katz nods. Outside dogs bark. Trucks approaching can be heard_from outside. The men look up. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  27 28 47.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish, to Biederman) Were new transports planned tonight?

dialogues.speaker: BIEDERMAN
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish, surprised) They didn’t tell me. The men go closer to the window. Saul stands up and goes toward the windows. Some men are already gathering near one of the windows, gazing out into the night, as if spellbound. The men look anxious and are increasingly agitated.

dialogues.speaker: SS OFFICER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (in German, shouts) Kapos! All Kapos! Saul moves away from the window and goes back toward his corner when Biederman grabs him by his arm.

dialogues.speaker: BIEDERMAN
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) You come with me. The two men hurry to the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. KREMATORIUM
dialogues.text: Saul and Biederman rush to the underground exit area.

dialogues.speaker: BIEDERMAN
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) You’re with me now. Two other KAPOS followed by two FOREMEN come along with t They go to the courtyard of the Krematorium. A group of S officers, led by VOSS, are already in the middle of the courtyard. Behind the fence civilians are endlessly walking into the Krematorium. Voss is yelling with another OFFICER before moving to the kapos. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  29 48.

dialogues.speaker: VOSS
dialogues.text: (in German) You all go and get the day shift men_too. Get them to work. All of you! The kapos glance at each other.

dialogues.speaker: KAPOS
dialogues.text: (in German) Yes, Sir Oberscharfiihrer! They run away.

dialogues.speaker: VOSS
dialogues.text: (in German, to Biederman) Count how many to treat still. He stays. He designates Saul. Biederman runs away, toward the Krematorium. Voss shakes his head while writing things down on a paper holds in his hands. He mutters something to the officer standing next to him, before leaving for the Krematorium. Saul stands there, clueless. Voss designates Saul and another PRISONER.

dialogues.speaker: VOSS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in German) You come with me. They walk behind Voss, as he enters the Krematorium_side leading to the office.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. KREMATORIUM - OFFICER’S ROOM - NIGHT Voss, Saul and the other prisoner enter the room. Voss si down at his desk. He is focused on some kind of mental operation. He designates a large table where a chaos of bottles of alcohol, burnt out cigars and cigarettes, fallen glasses, half-eaten plates of food, and a broken violin can be see

dialogues.speaker: VOSS
dialogues.text: (in German) Clean up! Saul and his fellow prisoner clean the table methodically Shooting Draft April 25, 2014

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voss keeps looking at his watch and at a letter in him. Biederman and two other KAPOS burst into the room.

dialogues.speaker: VOSS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in German) How many still to treat?

dialogues.speaker: BIEDERMAN
dialogues.text: (in German) 1000, Herr Oberscharfiihrer!

dialogues.speaker: VOSS
dialogues.text: (in German) 1000? You swines. There’1l be three time more tonight. He pauses. Biederman looks at Saul, still cleaning incredible mess in the room. 49. front of the Voss looks at his watch repeatedly, keeps talking to the kapos.

dialogues.speaker: VOSS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in German) It has to be over with by dawn. Every round: two men, a woman, and a child. Pull out the ash after two rounds. Ventilate every 12 minutes. You're in charge. Understood?

dialogues.speaker: BIEDERMAN
dialogues.text: (in German) Yes, Herr Oberscharfiihrer! Still cleaning, Saul uncovers a revolver on the table. He looks at it, mesmerized, hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: VOSS
dialogues.text: (in German) When you finish, you useless vermin, wash and disinfect it all. There’1ll be a new treatment. Voss stands up, goes to the table and takes the revolver. Biederman is about to leave.

dialogues.speaker: VOSS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in German) Last thing: get me a list of 70 men by tomorrow noon. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting Draft April 2

dialogues.speaker: VOSS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Men you can spare. We need them elsewhere. Dismissed! Biederman stops, spellbound.

dialogues.speaker: VOSS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (shouts in German) Dismissed! Saul looks on as they run out. Voss lights up a cigarette, lays back and looks up at the smoke rising from his cigarette. He looks at Saul.

dialogues.speaker: VOSS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in German) You go and get me Schlojme from the coal room. Saul, his hands full of dishes, stops and looks at Voss.

dialogues.speaker: VOSS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in German) Leave it here! Saul puts everything down and runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul enters the area behind the ovens where a dozen priso are continuously feeding a metal opening with coal. The flames are intense. Many prisoners are painted black by t soot and they all sweat. Saul sees a man organizing and supervising the work. He i his late thirties. His face is drawn, reddened by alcohol is a kapo: SCHLOJME. Saul goes to him.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) Herr Oberscharfiihrer... calls you. Schlojme shakes his head and leaves. A red-haired FOREMAN comes in the room. As Saul is trying get out, the kapo grabs him. He tosses him to the ground throws him a shovel. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  31 51.

dialogues.speaker: RED-HAIRED FOREMAN
dialogues.text: (in German) Work! Saul gets up. Completely lost, he looks at the entrance a at the foreman. He imitates what the others do: carrying coal all the way to the fire, in a constant inhuman pace. He goes to the fire and back. And back to the fire again. work silently around him. The foreman, in the background, beats a man who did not s to work hard enough.

dialogues.speaker: RED-HAIRED FOREMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in German) Faster! Now the foreman orders them to move an enormous trolley f of coal. Saul has to join the group, pushing the trolley, to no avail. The foreman becomes berserk and hit the men, including Sa with his stick. A man falls down, in pain. The trolley do not move.

dialogues.speaker: RED-HAIRED FOREMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in German) You move the trolley or you all burn! Exhausted, Saul looks at the entrance. Biederman appears, and comes closer.

dialogues.speaker: BIEDERMAN
dialogues.text: (in German, to the foreman) I take this one. He grabs Saul.

dialogues.speaker: RED-HAIRED FOREMAN
dialogues.text: (in German) Useless shit. Saul follows Biederman outside.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: In the courtyard, figures move behind the fence. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  52. The continuous humming of the Krematorium cover almost entirely the shouted orders of the quards. Men from Saul’s kommando are piling clothes on carts. Biederman and Saul find Abraham, Hirsch and Vassili.

dialogues.speaker: BIEDERMAN
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish, to Abraham) You were right. _We’re next. He wants 70 men by tomorrow. Abraham translates in a low voice in Russian to Vassili. Vassili says a few words in Russian to Abraham.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) Who is going to get the package then?

dialogues.speaker: BIEDERMAN
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) I am.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) I‘1l come with you. Ella knows me.

dialogues.speaker: BIEDERMAN
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) No, you need to stay here.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) Take Saul with you, then, she knows him.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) I don’t know her. Abraham becomes angry.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) Sure you do.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, to Abraham) I’m not going.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) You do as I say. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  53. The German officers are shouting orders. Confusion grows. Dogs are barking. Saul tries to leave and go back to the Krematorium. Abrah and Landesman block his way.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, to Saul) He goes with you.

dialogues.speaker: BIEDERMAN
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) Nothing. Both will go with you. In the courtyard stands the SS Commander Voss talking wit several OFFICERS. Biederman discreetly waves OFF SCREEN and a GROUP of 15 m lead by LEMKE, a Jewish kapo, push toward the gate huge c full of personal belongings_- clothes, suitcases, shoes, bundles, kitchen tools.

dialogues.speaker: VOSS
dialogues.text: (in German) What’s this, Oberkapo? We need all the men here!

dialogues.speaker: BIEDERMAN
dialogues.text: (in German) Herr Oberscharfiihrer, the men can’t work because of the belongings piling up! I am taking some men with me to the warehouse!

dialogues.speaker: VOSS
dialogues.text: (in German) Oberkapo, you stay here. These can go. Lemke instructs his men to start pushing the carts. TWO S GUARDS follow them.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  54. EXT. CAMP ALLEY / WAREHOUSE “KANADA” - NIGHT Saul pushes a cart with the prisoners, among them Landesm and Hirsch, in an alleyway of barracks as they draw near warehouse at the entrance of which an armed SS GUARD stan Landesman keeps a constant eye on Saul’s moves. + The men throw the clothes and other belongings on the gro Landesman stays close to Saul as they proceed with one of carts. Hirsch goes to the SS guard and discusses briefly with hi then hands him something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard takes Hirsch and Saul _to the side entrance. A female kapo named MANDEL steps out of the building. She t to the guard and lets Saul in. +

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. WAREHOUSE “KANADA” — NIGHT Saul enters the warehouse as four FEMALE JEWISH PRISONERS pass them by to go outside and get the new items back ins In the background, other FEMALE JEWISH PRISONERS with whi kerchiefs on their head work, putting sorted out items on large shelves. They use ladders to reach the shelves. FEM KAPOS oversee the operations. Cries of agony can be heard from afar. Mandel looks at Saul. +

dialogues.speaker: MANDEL
dialogues.text: (in German) The name of the girl?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Ella, Fried. Mandel goes toward the shelves. In the background, an old SS GUARD puts a cylinder onto a portable cylinder player. Music fills the warehouse - a female voice can be heard singing a romantic tune. Mandel comes back to Saul. She is followed by a young wom with a beautiful face and brown hair. It is ELLA. The two women stop in front of Saul. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  55.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE KAPO
dialogues.text: (in German) No touching. Under the supervision of Mandel, Ella looks at Saul with happy spark in her eyes. Saul avoids Ella’s eyes. Instead, he looks around her and sees a red-haired female prisoner, ESTERA and another FEM PRISONER pass by them. Ella’s face turns grave. Estera_ climbs on the ladder and_suddenly falls on the + shelves, and takes with her in a chain reaction several shelves full of household objects that fall onto the grou in a loud crashing sound. A sudden upheaval takes place. Young women rush to the sc from all around, some helping up Estera. + Mandel, cursing, hurries back to the shelves and start hitting the red-haired girl. Still looking at him, but with a rapid gesture, Ella take out a small package of her blouse and gives it to him. He fixes it under his shirt with a belt. She tries to take h hand, but he pushes her away.

dialogues.speaker: ELLA
dialogues.text: Saul. + Estera is still in the background, isolated by Mandel, wh forces her to use her hands to clean the broken glass and china. In the background, a FEMALE SS GUARD stops the music. +

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From outside, barking and voices can be heard. Saul leaves Ella and goes outside. At the door, the SS guard looks at him, slightly surprise

dialogues.speaker: SS GUARD 6
dialogues.text: (in German) That was quick! The four women go back inside the warehouse with their lo in their arms. Saul goes out with the quard. +

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  34 35 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prisoners push the empty carts_on the road. Saul is + shadowed by Landesman.

dialogues.speaker: LANDESMAN
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) Did you get it? +

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, irritated) Yes. + Closer to the gates of the Krematorium courtyard, they cr path with a LARGE GROUP OF CIVILIANS led by Shlojme’s kommando heading for the forest. SAUL (CONT’D) (in Hungarian) Where are they going?

dialogues.speaker: LANDESMAN
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) To the pits. The ovens must be + full. Saul moves rapidly to the other group and with lowered he joins it. Landesman, surprised, follows him. +

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul marches on a road in the dark within the group of civilians. The MAN walking next to him keeps looking at S Landesman tries to hold him back, but Saul advances and disappears in the crowd. +

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few SS soldiers with hand torches accompany them. They go deeper into the woods. Some projectors cast a har light on the path bordered by woods. Some prisoners of several Sonderkommandos circulate along the path. SS guards with dogs stand around, carefully watching. Saul walks beside civilians next a frail PRISONER WITH GLASSES.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in broken Yiddish) You can?... See? A rabbi here? The man_with glasses looks at him, but does not answer. + Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  57. Saul stops and lets his comrades go past him and disappea behind the crowd. New civilians keep coming. Other prison from the Sonderkommando circle them. Men, women, children start undressing. A low rumble of terrorized voice fills the air. A YOUNG WOMAN, who has been standing close to Saul, tries talk to him. She looks at Saul, waiting for some kind of answer. She tries to catch his arm. Saul pushes her back, and she stumbles. A FOREMAN pulls h up brutally. Saul sees the young woman as she pulls up her dress, glan around in a shy way. In the background a KAPO organizes his men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks away and sees a middle-aged man with a big beard RABBI, in the crowd. He is taking off his white shirt. Saul touches his arm. The rabbi and the few WOMEN around look at Saul in a strange way. SAUL (CONT’D) (in a mixture of Hungarian and Yiddish, whispers) You a rabbi? Come. The rabbi does not seem to understand. A middle-aged woma comes closer to Saul, shows the rabbi. RABBI’S WIFE Rebbe, rebbe. Behind Saul, another man with a slight beard, has stopped undressing and watches the scene. It is BRAUN, a tall man his forties. Saul turns his back on him. The strident sound of whistles can be heard, not far from them. Some orders are shouted. Braun catches Saul’s sleeve and tries to tell him somethi But Saul escapes from him and goes to two members of the Sonderkommando who are busy collecting personal belonging the ground. Saul picks up a jacket. All at once, the men of the Sonderkommando start pushing crowd further into the woods. The civilians depart reluctantly, and Saul follows suit, trying to get closer to the rabbi, who is bare-chested. Landesman appears for an instant somewhere in the crowd. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  58. Saul now walks next to the rabbi, and touches his shoulde He shows him the jacket he holds. He gives it to him. A KAPO appears and goes to Saul.

dialogues.speaker: KAPO IN THE WOODS
dialogues.text: (in German) You're not talking to anybody, are you? Saul shakes his head. Landesman sees Saul and tries to get closer. The whole group follows the path among the trees. A light is reflected on the faces. Smoke rises up in the air. People who still have some fab or clothing in their hand cover their faces. The loud sou of a gigantic fire burning and branches cracking overwhel the crying and the shouting of the people. Whistles can b heard throughout the scene. Saul concentrates on the rabbi. In the background, an enormous trench with fire burning in it_appears. SS OFFIC come and go near the edge of the trench, they seem to hol small weapons. Saul takes the rabbi by his arm, and brings him to Schloj who stands on the side. Shlojme is discreetly drinking fr bottle.

dialogues.speaker: SCHLOJME
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) You here?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in broken Yiddish) Strong man for Sonderkommando. Schlojme shrugs his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: SCHLOJME
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) You want to be replaced already? In the background, near the trench, it is now obvious tha some people are brought to the officers. Gunshots are hea Busch comes and goes along the trench, with an excited lo on his face, and hastens the men of the Sonderkommandos. young woman disappears near the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  59.

dialogues.speaker: BUSCH
dialogues.text: (in German, to the men of the Sonderkommando) Jews, that’s how you do it! Moaning all around. On the faces of the prisoners of the Sonderkommando, the horror. Saul takes Schlojme’s arm and pushing the rabbi along, he heads toward an SS OFFICER. The officer turns to Schlojme.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER 4
dialogues.text: (in German) What?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in broken Yiddish, to Schlojme) Tell. Strong man, for + Sonderkommando... +

dialogues.speaker: SCHLOJME
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) You lost your mind?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER 4
dialogues.text: (in German) What? The SS sees something behind, and takes the rabbi’s arm, pushes Saul to the side, who falls. Schlojme glances at h and hurries away. Saul sees a forest of naked legs around him. Some people trousers, they run. Some yell. Saul, still on the ground, sees as the rabbi is taken by officer to the trench and shot. Saul sees Landesman, takes by Busch, furious. Landesman t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to explain something. Busch shots Landesman, he falls to ground. + Saul slowly tries to get up, but hears something from beh

dialogues.speaker: BRAUN
dialogues.text: Rabbi. Rabbi. Saul_undoes his Sonderkommando jacket and shirt, and give them to the man who peers out of the darkness. + Saul, half naked, looks for the right clothes in the chao Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  60. Suddenly, an SS GUARD grabs his arm and pushes him into t line of civilians aligned in front of the burning trench.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in German) Sonderkommando. Sonderkommando! The guard does not even listen. Saul looks around, helpless, as people disappear in front him into the trench. At the end of the line an SS OFFICER with a revolver is standing next to Mietek, who’s acting hectically. Saul looks around at the faces of people waiting for thei death. When it is his turn, the SS OFFICER raises his weapon. Saul looks at Mietek, who looks at him, disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: MIETEK
dialogues.text: (in German) You are from a Kommando, you vermin!

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in German) B-7005, Sonderkommando! Mietek takes Saul out of the line.

dialogues.speaker: MIETEK
dialogues.text: (in German) This time you’d better have two bracelets. Saul looks inside the shoes lying on the ground. Mietek furiously hits him with his stick.

dialogues.speaker: MIETEK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in German) Hurry! A voice shouts Mietek’s name. Mietek freezes and runs off Saul grabs a pair of trousers on the ground. He quickly dresses up, and runs out, looking for the man he saved. He finds him on the side. Then, he takes him when no guar watching to a few meters into the woods. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  61.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, breathless) You will help me bury my son. Saul wraps Braun’s bearded face in a strip of clothe. He wraps Braun’s arm as well, as if burned. +

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prisoners of the Sonderkommando stand in front of the gat watched by a GUARD. Braun stands next to Saul, quietly shivering. Braun looks back at the woods behind. + Schlojme, the intoxicated kapo, counts the men.

dialogues.speaker: SCHLOJME
dialogues.text: (in German)
Schlojme starts talking to another Kapo, as if something wrong. An SS OFFICER comes to them.

dialogues.speaker: SS OFFICER 4
dialogues.text: (in German) 67? What’s going on, you filthy + scum? The kapos talk to him, but their conversation cannot be heard. Saul and Braun look at the scene. Braun seems terrorized. Schlojme, weary, comes toward them. He looks at the man, then at Saul.

dialogues.speaker: SCHLOJME
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish, whispers) Who the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in broken Yiddish) He’s from Krema II. Biederman expects him.

dialogues.speaker: SCHLOJME
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) The hell I care! The SS officer walks toward them. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  62.

dialogues.speaker: SS OFFICER 5
dialogues.text: (in German) Kapo, what's going on with the numbers?? Schlojme does not move for seconds. And then...

dialogues.speaker: SCHLOJME
dialogues.text: (in German) Abgang, Herr Untersharfiihrer.

dialogues.speaker: SS OFFICER 4
dialogues.text: (in German, indifferent) We'll see at roll call. The officer moves away. The gates open. They enter the krematorium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRISONERS’ HALL UNDER THE ROOF - SAUL’S CORNER - NIGHT The group of exhausted prisoners, among them Saul and Bra walk behind the silent ovens. They climb up the stairs. Frankel reaches Saul at the top of the stairs. Yankl foll them as they go further in the attic.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKEL
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) Why did you bring this one in?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in broken Yiddish) Rabbi. Frankel looks startled. They reach Saul’s corner. Braun enters and lies down on the camp bed. Saul turns to Frankel, who is still behind. SAUL (CONT’D) (in broken Yiddish) For the dead.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKEL
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) We carry our dead ourselves. A beat. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  63.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) People come to me.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in broken Yiddish) I did.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKEL
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) I said a Kaddish. Saul doesn’t answer. Yankl catches them up. He peers into Saul’s corner.

dialogues.speaker: YANKL
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) This is a bandit who snores. Saul enters his corner. Frankel and Yankl leave. Braun is asleep. Saul points to a sheet below a little curtain in the hidd corner of the room.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) That’s the boy._I hid him. Braun doesn’t wake up. SAUL (CONT’D) (in Hungarian) You'll tell me what to do. Saul goes to the body, kneels down, touches the sheet. When he turns back, Braun has fallen asleep. Saul gets up, pours some water from a tank in a dish and it next to the boy. He is about to uncover the body when hears murmurs from outside. Saul hurries back to the bed. Then, he goes back to the body and uncovers it. He looks it for some time. With delicate gestures, he pours some water on the frail chest, and cleans the skin. He clears the face as well. A smile on his face. A strange light illuminates his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  38 64. He gazes at it and eventually puts back the sheet onto th body.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. KREMATORIUM - SAUL’S CORNER / PRISONERS’ ROOM UNDER

dialogues.speaker: ROOF
dialogues.text: Steps can be heard behind the door. Saul gets up and goes to the curtain. Abraham stands in t doorway, Saul keeps the door half-closed.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) Where have you been all night?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) I was taken to the pits.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) Where’s the powder? Saul looks up, confused.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, impatient) The package sent by the women? Saul feels his trousers, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) Fallen... Abraham looks at him, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) How will we blow up this thing now? Angry, Abraham pushes Saul inside his corner. Braun wakes Abraham looks at Braun and back at Saul, astonished. In a rush of wrath, he grabs Saul’s collar.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) He’1ll help us tomorrow! Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  65.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) You found him?? + Abraham lets go of him. +

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, whispers) You pick a rabbi from the dead? + Vassili appears, looking at the scene. +

dialogues.speaker: VASSILI
dialogues.text: (in Russian, to Saul) Where’s the bundle? Abraham leans toward Vassili, explaining something to him

dialogues.speaker: VASSILI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Russian) Stupid Jew. Vassili looks at Saul, anger blurs his eyes. He punches S in the stomach, cursing in Russian. Abraham stands there, does not intervene. Saul falls on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Russian) Stop! Vassili hits Saul one last time and leaves. + When Saul gets up again, Abraham has uncovered the body a is kneeling by him. Braun is watching from the bed. Saul goes to the body and covers him back.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) My son.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, dismayed) But you have no son. He tries to remain calm.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) I do. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 39 66. Abraham looks at Saul. SAUL (CONT’D) (in Hungarian) I_have to bury my son.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, annihilated) You_ don’t need a rabbi for that!

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, pointing at Braun) At least he will do what’s right. Abraham goes toward the curtain._He keeps an eye on Braun

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, to Saul) This man stays in the room. You get rid of the body. Abraham leaves.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. KREMATORIUM - SAUL’S CORNER - DAWN Saul goes to Braun, takes a razor out of his pocket and starts shaving the man, looking at his face. Braun does not look into Saul’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. KREMATORIUM
dialogues.text: Saul and Braun are digging in the ground with shovels. Ne to them, there is a cart covered with a canvas. They are standing in an area partially covered by a large canvas in a corner of the courtyard. Bricks and boards ar aligned on the side, along with shovels and other tools. Around them other PRISONERS are busy working. Saul stops when he feels a hand on his arm. It is Feigenb

dialogues.speaker: FEIGENBAUM
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) Don’t dig here! Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  40 67.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) I don’t understand. He resumes his digging.

dialogues.speaker: FEIGENBAUM
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) What did you say? Braun stops and looks at Feigenbaum. Feigenbaum tries to speak to him in Yiddish. + Feigenbaum loses his patience.

dialogues.speaker: FEIGENBAUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish, to Saul) This is my spot! + An alarm goes off somewhere near the Krematorium. The men are seemingly confused. Prisoners run out of the building, ordered by guards to + gather in the courtyard. . + A Kapo comes toward Saul and Braun.

dialogues.speaker: KAPO
dialogues.text: (in German) Schnell! Feigenbaum and the workers run out of the work area towar the courtyard where the guards have already started direc the prisoners into a side entrance. Saul loses Braun and engulfed in the crowd, enters the + darkness of the side entrance.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. KREMATORIUM
dialogues.text: Saul is standing still among the other prisoners. The roo packed. The worried faces of many men can be seen around Some whisper to each other. No sign of Braun. Saul pushes the men around him and looks at the faces as proceeds forward in the room. He looks for Braun. + A low rumble of mixed voices can be heard, in all languag Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  68.

dialogues.speaker: LEMKE
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) 70 men?

dialogues.speaker: GREEK PRISONER I
dialogues.text: (in Greek) Did the Oberkapo make the list?

dialogues.speaker: GREEK PRISONER II
dialogues.text: (in Greek) How many men? Vassili grabs Saul’s shirt. Saul pushes him away and proc throught the crowd, looking.

dialogues.speaker: BIEDERMAN
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) Have to be quick.

dialogues.speaker: HIRSCH
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) Krema II won't move a finger... Saul keeps on moving forward. The men all turn silent as the noise of trucks and shoute orders can be heard outside.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (in German) Faster! The men look at each other. Saul follows Biederman next to a group of several men intensely arguing. Vassili stands in the middle of the gr with Abraham, Feigenbaum and other men. Abraham tells something to Feigenbaum, who leaves the gro and goes whispering something into the men’s ears who sta further. Feigenbaum passes Saul, and goes to Frankel and Hirsch, w are close to Saul. Saul goes toward Abraham, who is carefully listening to t conversations around him. He looks up at Saul but does no tell him anything. Saul spots Frankel_who stands next to a_small group, look

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: down. . Shooting Draft April 25, 2014

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) And this man now. Behind, Yankl and a POLISH PRISONER stand next to Braun, harassing him.

dialogues.speaker: YANKL
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) Well, rabbi? It’s sabbath.

dialogues.speaker: POLISH PRISONER
dialogues.text: (in Polish) Can’t you talk? Saul goes to them and tries to stand tall. POLISH PRISONER (CONT’D) (in Polish) What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) You leave him.

dialogues.speaker: YANKL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, ironic) He should do the service.

dialogues.speaker: HIRSCH
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) We'll die because of you two.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in broken Yiddish) We're already dead. Saul takes Braun’s arm, lifts him up, and they go toward 69. Abraham._Yankl_ and Hirsch disappear. Braun is afraid, ca look into Abraham's eyes. Saul, weary, looks at Abraham. SAUL (CONT’D) (in Hungarian) I_have to take care of my son. Abraham's gaze is cold, with no empathy.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: in Hungarian) What son?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) He’s not from my wife. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4l 70. A pause. +

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) When did you last see him? A pause. Saul looks down. + Abraham looks at Saul as if asking. +

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) You have no son. A beat. + The door flings open, the daylight blinds everybody. Four SS GUARDS led by an OFFICER barge in. They go to Biederman, standing very close to Saul, grab him by the armpits and take him out of the room. The door slams behind them. In shock, the men stay silent for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul looks at Abraham, who does not pay attention to him. Abraham's first reaction is to consult with Vassili. +

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. KREMATORIUM —- COURTYARD - DAY The diffused morning pours a strange light on the men ali in ranks in the courtyard. The men are weary and worried, try to look around, but th guards around them are aggressive and watch out. Next to Saul stands Abraham. Saul seems endlessly weary. Saul sees Miklos, looking battered, exiting the building. Miklos looks among the men aligned. He comes to Saul.

dialogues.speaker: MIKLOS
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, in an excited voice) Find me a boy. Same age, same look. Miklos barely waits for Saul’s answer and goes back towar the Krematorium. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  42 43 71. The chief doctor exits the building. Miklos stops. The ch doctor passes him by without a look and leaves the courty though the gate. Miklos enters the Krematorium.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) You failed the living for the dead. Saul does not answer. He looks back at Braun. SS guards gather at the other end of the courtyard. They toward the prisoners and order them into the Krematorium.

dialogues.speaker: SS GUARD
dialogues.text: (in German) To the undressing room! The prisoners move toward the entrance door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men are brought to the undressing room, where pieces clothes are scattered on the ground. The guards start shouting orders.

dialogues.speaker: SS GUARDS
dialogues.text: (in German) Gather all clothes! Fast! Saul sees jackets marked with red Xs on the back. He take one up, shows it to the others.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKEL
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) Another Kommando! Next to Frankel, Yankl, in his cavalry trousers, kneels d and starts gathering the clothes. Frankel pulls him up. Clothes go from one hand to the other.

dialogues.speaker: HIRSCH
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) They burnt them! Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  44 45 72. The prisoners refuse to obey. Guards start hitting some of the prisoners. Abraham kneels down next to a pile and uncovers Biederman tin box. He lifts it up for all to see.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) The initial surprise turns into a wave of wrath that cros the room. In the background, a man wrestles with a guard. The guard look at the scene, startled. They are pushed back by the prisoners. The rebellion rises. Shouts, chaos and confusion take over the room. Hammers, shovels and sticks appear in the hands of the prisoners. The guards try to contain them, but to no avail. People run in all directions, guards and some kapos are beaten. Some prisoners are shot. Some others manage to ta sticks and guns from the hands of two guards. Saul looks for Braun in the room. He finds him and they go with the flow toward the exit wh a general rumble takes over the Krematorium and its surroundings. Just as the two men approach the exit, Vassili seizes Sau and forces him to come with him. Saul looks behind him but he has lost sight of Braun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vassili brings Saul to Abraham, who is pouring some fuel the walls and the floor with two OTHER MEN. Mattresses ar burning. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  46 73. Abraham comes down to meet them.

dialogues.speaker: VASSILI
dialogues.text: (in Russian) I brought this one. Use him. Abraham looks tense as he looks up and notices Saul. Gunshots can be heard from outside. Vassili runs down wit Lemke, both carrying hand-made grenades.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) Let me go. Abraham looks at Saul, his eyes filled with pity and ange He turns his back on Saul. Saul rushes out.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. KREMATORIUM
dialogues.text: In the exit area, a grenade explodes. Saul follows prisoners rushing out. In the courtyard, the confusion spreads to the entire are Prisoners and guards are shouting. Bullets are fired from both sides. A strong explosion shakes the Krematorium’s walls. Saul l up and around. Smoke everywhere. Amidst machine gun fire, Saul finds Braun. He takes his a and they run to the work area. Saul looks under the canva for the body. He lifts it up. Prisoners in the courtyard continue fighting. Saul sees as on the other side of the fence, a military t draws nearer. Prisoners with wire cutters cut the barbed wires, creatin opening through the fence. Some prisoners escape through opening, toward the forest. Saul looks back to the military truck. SS guards are pour out of it. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  47 74. Saul looks at Braun, who seems to be looking for an opportunity to flee.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in broken Yiddish) Follow. They start running amidst the bullets toward the opening. They leave the courtyard, running in the smoke and chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men run in the woods with the corpse still wrappe a sheet. In the distance, sporadic shots can be heard. They are both exhausted. Saul does not let his companion stop, even for a second. Then, after taking a path that goes down a little slope hidden by the trees, Saul suddenly stops. Saul starts digging with his hand by the roots of a large tree. Braun looks at him, clueless. He tries to pull Saul up as footsteps can be heard drawing nearer. Braun looks at Saul, who relentlessly resumes digging the earth with his hands.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in broken Yiddish) Kaddish. Kaddish. Please. Say it.

dialogues.speaker: BRAUN
dialogues.text: (very low) Yitgaddal veyitgqaddash shmeh rabba... Braun suddenly stops. Saul looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: BRAUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Greek) I forgot. Braun runs_away. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  48 75.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) You! Saul gets up, takes the corpse and follows him, also runn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saul, carrying the wrapped corpse, stops by the river, wh he finds Braun. He softly puts the corpse down to the ground. Dog barking be heard. Behind him eight fugitives of the Sonderkommando run out the woods, with Feigenbaum and Frankel leading them. Some them carry a revolver or a stick. Feigenbaum is wounded. The fugitives look briefly at the two men. Feigenbaum does not stop.

dialogues.speaker: FEIGENBAUM
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish, to his companions) Don’t waste your time. Come on! He goes to the water and starts swimming. The men all follow Feigenbaum into the river. Braun goes into the water. Saul tries to grab Braun.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian) Help me. Braun stops, and looks at Saul, before swimming away. Saul _goes back to the boy, uncovers the young face and l at it. He takes up the body and enters the water. He tries to maintain the body above the water, while swim toward the other side. Reaching the middle of the river, he looks around. He is alone. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  49 76. The stream is too powerful. Saul, with no forces left, almost drowning, lets the body of his control. He watches helplessly as the wrapped body is taken by the waters and slowly disappears. Saul starts drowning. Frankel reaches Saul and helps him to the other side. Saul does not resist, but his face is now transformed, engulfed by helplessness.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. WOODS / BARN
dialogues.text: Saul is pushed forward by Frankel, who trails the other fugitives in the woods. They come upon a derelict barn. The men enter. Saul is the last to enter. Feigenbaum is on the floor, one of the fugitives attend t his wound. He looks battered. Some fugitives look at the scene, worried. Others try to dry their clothes with straw.

dialogues.speaker: FEIGENBAUM
dialogues.text: (in Yiddish) Five minutes, we have to go on. Frankel looks at Saul, who stands still, silent. Two men are in a heated discussion about their plans to r the Partisans. The entrance door is suddenly opened. The men are stirred up, most of them jump up. A YOUNG BOY dressed in peasant clothes slowly enters the room. He must be 12 at most, but already robust. His hair fair, and he contemplates these ragged men with uttermost interest. The men look at him, amazed. Shooting Draft April 25, 2014  77. The boy takes a few steps in the room, as if he were a general in a review of his troops. He curses in Polish, a imitating his father. He smiles. He examines all the men, some from a close distance. He arrives near Saul and looks at him. Saul looks up at the boy. The boy is now suddenly serious Scared, the boy runs out of the hut.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WOODS
dialogues.text: The boy keeps running in the woods. A sudden upheaval of voices and footsteps. An SS squad pa him by and go in the direction of the hut. He is pushed o the ground. The soldiers quietly take position around the hut. As the soldiers besiege the hut and open fire on it, the child is frightened, and runs away further deep in the wo The camera stops. We see further and further away the chi running and finally disappearing among the trees. THE END.
